intro: Hellenocarum, commonly known as the common rockrose, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hellenocarum is characterized by its upright growth habit and succulent, fleshy leaves. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
